questions.question: A key purpose of Henry Clay’s American System was to

choices.answer: protect the institution of slavery in the west
develop a national economy by improving transportation
improve diplomatic relations with Europe
grow support for the Federalist political party

questions.question: Under Chief Justice John Marshall, Supreme Court decisions tended to

choices.answer: restrict federal powers of taxation
expand state control of economic activity
reduce federal control of the economy
promote business enterprise
a tariff for the protection of industry
an end to federal spending on canals and roads
a strict interpretation of the Constitution
a tax on federal land to pay for public schools

questions.question: Which Court case affirmed the right of the judicial branch to determine the constitutionality of laws?

choices.answer: Gibbons v. Ogden
Marbury v. Madison
McCulloch v Maryland
Dred Scott v. Sanford

questions.question: The issuance of the Monroe Doctrine did which of the following?

choices.answer: declared U.S. dominance in Africa and the Middle East
ended the tradition of U.S. neutrality in European wars
warned Europe not to colonize Latin America
established the U.S. as a world economic power

questions.question: All of these were part of the Henry Clay's American system EXCEPT-

choices.answer: funding internal improvements
re-establishing the Bank of the United States
the national assumption of state debts
enacting protective tariffs

questions.question: The Era of Good Feelings was characterized by all of the following EXCEPT-

choices.answer: dominance of the Democratic-Republican Party
cultural nationalism
U.S. influence over North America and Western hemisphere
stronger ties between the U.S. and France

questions.question: President Monroe vetoed bills providing funds for internal improvements because he claimed-

choices.answer: only the President could order the construction of roads and canals
the Constitution did not allow for spending on roads and canals
roads and canals only benefitted manufacturers
western farmers preferred to be isolated
